value.0: <StartAction>[Zhiram, the rather eccentric High Sorcerer of Ghaarak, greets you heartily as you approach.]</Start> Welcome and well met, young <lad/lass>! Might I ask what brings such esteemed company to my chamber?

Oh well... I was hoping for a bit of good company for a change. It does get a bit lonely around here at times. But I can understand a young <lad/lass> like yourself not wanting to stand about all day with an old fool like myself.
Feel free to come back by anytime you like, and I bid thee a good <quarterday>!

Not much worth talking about, I'm afraid. Janthos the Inventor, a Gnomish student of mine, has been working on several experiments with the constructs. You may want to see if you can track him down, if you're looking for something a bit more exciting.

This, young <sir/madam>, is the Chamber of the Control Stone! Harnessing the collective power of Ghaarak's most powerful sorcerers, the Control Stone has allowed us to achieve grand heights in arcane advancement!
The main purpose of the Control Stone is to operate the Imperial District's magical defense, in the event that Ghaarak were to ever come under attack.

You see, by utilizing the massive power locked within the Control Stone, we can indefinitely raise a protective shield around each of the gates in the Imperial District. These shields are impervious to all forms of damage, a grand defense indeed!

In addition to our defense system, however, the Control Stone also operates the magical constructs you have likely seen wandering the Imperial District. These massive laborers allow us to enjoy a bit of comfort, mindlessly performing all heavy physical labor in our place.

I'm afraid that is quite impossible at the moment, <lad/lass>. The stone must be kept active to allow the constructs to operate. Unfortunately, while the stone is in operation, it is extremely dangerous to manipulate.
<StartAction>[Zhiram seems a bit worried by your remark.]</Start> Do you truly think so? Why, I had never any thought of that... magic is my life, after all...

Ah, but that would be impossible! The constructs are built to specifically follow the orders of the Control Stone. They are incapable of acting without its direction. So, you see, we are in complete control of the whole system.
You've been speaking with that druidess, Alia, too much, my young friend! This age shall be one of great magical advancement, and to resist such change is to risk a weakness to our enemies!

Indeed it is, my young friend, indeed it is! Soon, we will be capable of automating the entirety of Ghaarak, a feat that may be commonplace in the civilized regions of the Empire, but a monumental achievement here along the frontier!
Is there anything else I may help you with today, <lad/lass>?

Ah, yes, that they did! It's currently locked away in the Imperial Treasury, and Magistrate Okaris refuses to let anyone inside to examine it. I hope he shall change his mind ere too long, for I would very much like to take a look at it.

I'm not sure exactly where they surfaced that marvel at, but even from this chamber, I can feel its massive power humming away! Perhaps it is some lost artifact from the ancient days of the Golden Age! Now that would be a find, indeed!
That I have not quite figured out. He seems to fear his find, for reasons that elude me. Your father is a warrior at heart, though, and they have little understanding of such things as this.
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_KARA" >>
Just passing through, Zhiram.
Anything interesting going on around here?
What can you tell me about this chamber?
Interesting, but I truly must be leaving...
Mind if I take a look at the Control Stone?
You've spent too much time in here, Zhiram...
Constructs seem dangerous. What if they turn on us?
That seems unnatural. What if our lives become too easy?
Seems like a very efficient system.
Actually, I think I'll be on my way...
What do you know of this strange gem my father discovered?
Can I ask you about something else?
Why has my father locked this jewel away?
